Foreign Diplomats Visit Factory in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Factory in Pyongyang 
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys and staff members of embassies and representatives of international organizations here Thursday visited the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory.
ï¿½@In front of the monuments to the on-the-spot instructions given by President Kim Il Sung and leader  Kim Jong Il the guests were briefed on the fact that the factory has turned into the nation's leading electric wire producer under the care of the peerlessly great persons. Then they looked round the room devoted to the history of the factory.    
 They went round with keen attention various work sites of the factory including the self-reliance shop, a wire drawing shop and a cable shop where a variety of quality electric wire were pouring out and cultural practices in production and hygiene were on a high level.
 At the end of the visit they made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Declaration Movement of Democratic Figures Announced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Declaration Movement of Democratic Figures Announced in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- The south Korean People's Solidarity for Abolition of the "National Security Law" reportedly held a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 7 and announced the start of a declaration movement of 10,000 democratic figures for abolition of the NSL from Dec. 1.
 At the press conference speakers recalled that the Grand National Party and other anti-reunification forces evoked the "National Security Law" to block inter-Korean relations favorably developing and turn back history under the pretext of the recent case of Prof. Kang Jong Gu at Dongguk University.
 They said that with the regular session of the "National Assembly" at hand the conscientious forces would conduct a declaration movement from Dec. 1 to build public opinion for abrogation of the NSL and protect democracy and human rights on the strength of the masses.    
 The organization announced at the press conference that it would set a week for abolition of the NSL beginning with the declaration movement and hold a candle-light rally, an "evening for abrogation of the NSL, democracy and human rights" and others.

articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Meets Delegation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju Friday met and had a compatriotic talk with a delegation of Korean traders and industrialists in Japan with Ryang Su Jong, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, as its adviser and with Ri Pong Guk, chairman of the Federation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan, as its head on a visit to the socialist homeland on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the formation of the FKTIJ at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Party School of C.C., CPC
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Party School of C.C., CPC
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China.
 It was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, today by Deputy Director of the Party School of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China Yu Yunyao who is leading the delegation of the school on a visit to the DPRK.

Message of Sympathy to Jordanian King
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Jordanian King
    Pyongyang, November 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of sympathy to Abdullah II, king of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, as regards casualties caused by suicide bombings in Amman.
 The message expressed deep consolation to the king and through him to the Jordanian government and the bereaved families of the victims.
